bugs.cf_release_notes:
Since IT is triggering refresh pools off of expiry, the solution was to unbind expired subscriptions during refresh pools.

Refresh pools will now remove any expired subscriptions, along with any of its associated pools, and will revoke consumer's entitlements from these pools.
bugs.summary: expired subscriptions are still bound to the consumer

bugs.creator: Dennis Crissman
bugs.cf_environment:
Groups:   None (edit)
[reply] [−]
Private
Description Dennis Crissman 2014-05-05 14:02:59 EDT

When a PersistenceException is caught in the KingpinJob, the quartz job is rescheduled. This is done to make sure that the task eventually completes. 

I am good with this in theory, the problem is when the task is never going to succeed, in this case an infinite loop is essentially created. I would like to see a configurable max number of retries that throws a MaxRetriesException (copywrite dcrissman 2014) or something like that to indicate the task has hit the limit.
bugs.summary: Continuous job retry
